resources.string: What is Substratum?

Substratum is an app that takes advantage of Sony\'s Overlay Manager Service (OMS). This is similar to Layers in terms of stability and customization (as it builds off RRO) but features such things as no reboots to apply, boot animations, fonts and priority switching.
What is the Theme Interfacer?

The Theme Interfacer is the base of what allows Substratum to run like a Theme Engine. The idea of an interface is to simulate the “server/client” technicalities and Substratum communicates with the Interfacer handlers to signal commands directly on the system.
What do I need in order for Substratum to work properly?
You will need a ROM that has support for the OMS and Theme Interfacer system (ask them, they will know), this app, and a compatible theme (check its Play Store description or ask the developer)
Can I use Substratum even if my ROM does not have OMS support?

Yes, if your ROM has support for RRO (stock Nougat falls into the category). The other requirements above are the same (root, this app, and a compatible theme). You will apply the same way but the compilation and apply steps are combined and a reboot is required to apply the overlays.
How do I apply a theme?

The application of a theme is a two part process: compilation of the overlays and application of the overlays. Go into the theme, click the Overlay Manager tab, select the overlays and options you want, hit the FAB and choose Compile/Update, then chose those same overlays, and hit the FAB and choose Enable Selected.
My overlays did not compile, what happened?
Delete your /system/bin/aopt file, relaunch the application, and try the above process again.
My theme did not apply, what happened?
If you are applying a theme for the first time or from the stock theme, make sure you do not have the \"Disable other themes\" option checked.
I\'m bootlooping! How do I fix it?

Substratum has it\'s own recovery system called Substratum Rescue System (SRS), which is an automated system that dumps an archive into /storage/emulated/0/substratum/SubstratumRescue.zip. Flash this ZIP in recovery and reboot!
Some elements look janky after I applied a theme, what happened?
1. Restart SystemUI if it didn\'t do so automatically.\n2. Reboot the phone.\n3. Disable and/or disable the overlays, recompile, and reenable.
Where are overlays installed?
Overlays are installed in the /data/app folder, which means each overlay getting its own folder.
I\'m getting an error when trying to update a theme on the Play Store.
Uninstall the theme and reinstall it.
Who do I contact if I have a serious issue not resolved by reading these steps?
Please make a post in the Substratum Google+ community. Please provide the following information: Substratum version, ROM, theme (if issues applying one), and, if possible, a logcat.
How do I use substratum on my Samsung device?

If your Samsung device is running Nougat, Substratum will be able to utilise a built-in feature to allow Substratum themes to work. Substratum will prompt you to purchase the Samsung Integration Addon when you launch the app for the first time.
Help, I installed an overlay on my Samsung device and it won\'t boot now!
Slide the navdrawer out and head to the XDA thread for instructions on how to recover from this particular situation.
